document.title: Mississippi College and Career Readiness Standards for English Language Arts

A5D77DAF0FED4B4CA70DB768C07E6037.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

10AFAC6230114FA2BB43F98E5EA1FC35.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

80C85591BF0F4139B1AB7086B20D4264.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

B1795EDC3D6549CA9A2139A6A4529F18.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

3CA605BA6B4C4FCD9E732E58F8145062.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

420E96D0C3454148AFF1695216D7646D.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings.

857A6FAEABC54032A9F26761EAAA6454.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

61C29E687319465AA4AC3172986DD449.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

E54CC88F3E5840139F3F4EDA79F6C7BC.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content.

0BC43E698B1D4567B6C905A05539E148.description: Spell simple words phonetically, drawing on knowledge of sound-letter relationships.

BFB7405474C8440680340A0395225D72.description: Write a letter or letters for most consonant and short-vowel sounds (phonemes).

DD6F57DC63344EDD92BF83979C1293AD.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

A6F5D2E09F574019AEACCC26A4CD5B56.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

E3EBFE343A804775B769C39E4F02AD8C.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

5A4A3AD4DF234AA2B9741E9ACCF49BF7.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

18F3C9C1813B412B8B57C9BA0244C1C8.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

D855A6E439AF446EA5A3788F0B5A9E37.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

FE81513786C14A0B8B78F784955C94D0.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

F77468445D2041EDA84C8D153DC98CDE.description: Print many upper- and lowercase letters.

617A0BBF372342F4B79D300CE3884837.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

1F9CAA6761224BBA9E1ABA5F2E042E8C.description: Speak audibly and express thoughts, feelings, and ideas clearly.

9EEA1F152F2346A2A9514F875304D251.description: Add drawings or other visual displays to descriptions as desired to provide additional detail.

7640107184904C86B66584379FA8C2C9.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

0240F93140234282B0A8456A32F7F881.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

54EA9DDB6A254176B6FB6B8E0CBB2EE6.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

A2ACE7206E6140ECB73BE3312129914D.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

4DCF0FE8E5904AA182D77B4FC2E020C9.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

485408890FD949A7B41DC4CEC6431590.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups.

45360852C7074D3FBAF7343DC14E1CE4.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

962265E666F043AD82CFD6BDC9AE875B.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them).

496A3BAC28E543EBBF16C336BA6A33D6.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

6804CEA4E4234289BCD3CE85FA56BC0D.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

7DEB7BA764BD4AB79F66733E21F687F8.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

C3AE44CB36814351949A325B9560A50D.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

506E1644539C4BD1AAF94CE33B170562.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

E324C9CEC4F74943A015488E6B772FCA.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion or preference about the topic or book (e.g., My favorite book isâ€¦).

10980073FB1A4669AFEE5549F3B92A4E.description: Read emergent-reader texts with purpose and understanding.

85ACD96B017A4DECA878E6BD04546B7A.description: Distinguish between similarly spelled words by identifying the sounds of the letters that differ.

F559A8F66F1C4132B077645055932030.description: Read common high-frequency words by sight (e.g., the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

67D657CBD9DF4CE8BF7AB3185D8D6A59.description: Associate the long and short sounds with the common spellings (graphemes) for the five major vowels.

57BCE0AA50DA45D38463F6A31CF70036.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound or many of the most frequent sounds for each consonant.

565CB3C35149475BA0061F1E1BCA6366.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills in decoding words.

E84A0C75BAF6446B98D97B1549DD4ED0.description: Add or substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

E6801E239E9D486CB02ACD2741EC5DB2.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in three-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words.(This does not include CVCs ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.)

4E59F6B449C945D6B8C9EAB897349A5D.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

530F6FB5B43F41919CC887D08373E08F.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in spoken words.

399E8F12B30048469D95C86C8E66431A.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

40A3BAED740740ED9D484C17B294D9C2.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

DE573BBB19094887BA644F51440E1DD9.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

80FB1A8169854E0E88F878E518DA56BC.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

C22D5F5D17694429BE2938ACD119186A.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

CC09D6E94DA149AC8085EEE275F2BA2A.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

10C19E761ECD4B969DC6C1A87F6AD5BB.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

95C9A3A2FDED4B34A74AF70132CDB3D6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

CE539580ACB740669236CCAD6087D0EF.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

907F3D9B56F14B8B98E713A0F83C5AFB.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

6B20AC5B0C0D488581942DB58B302698.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text an illustration depicts).

88345636264D4B43A65DF7B3C55782E9.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

05B2B4F1017E42F08835055350F8C5C9.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

040EC74CF83C4AD7AB0D81759ABFBE65.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

B991B842B9A1441C9FEC59BB0DE9D54B.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

B8DF38A90C4048E7AA1139AE8F909413.description: With prompting and support, identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

34C3812326E64392821F53BB35BB4B9E.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

B40248E87C064195B6F35222D9406A65.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

041AED50E7144C6AB5CF3AC5D63247E1.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

ECCBDAE1D9274C3AA617837266E0CF42.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

74CF2A310B484FDEA0651FBE49632B25.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

93E358D41E2B4C6FB14F4AEE01AC04ED.description: With prompting and support, name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story.

DABACD807C304A4A87E2B8AABC80170C.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

AB07D1D2E543448B84CE17884A39B001.description: Ask and answer questions about unknown words in a text.

882AF335D1FD4B7EA8463B80BD81359B.description: With prompting and support, identify characters, settings, and major events in a story.

04DABEE7CD7C46F8AA7F0AF775D185E3.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

9409FADE66E446E6B66E0587F3B255EB.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

FB0C18BFCDDA4342A1303BF690B85A3C.description: Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in gathering vocabulary knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

1364BE18F44944E191C11937084E0079.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.

292688A8553D4AB5BA649E1F74B660FB.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

55C65CD3C82E47E98C492083B2A924E7.description: Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully when reading or listening.

6322BBDCFF3743A4BF15A95B0A1103B3.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.

02EB63E6F4604180BE3B50CE50D7527C.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.

22D0B619D0A74040A2945464F4FF1C2D.description: College and Career Readiness Standards: Language

941C3AD5D6FE474CB5D10DD65C9F252C.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks, demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate.

9BCE7594F11C48429D3EA88FF217EE13.description: Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance understanding of presentations.

BC53C778307B4815A12513B5E6615AF4.description: Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

822CEBD065354599811B15D6B99BCC95.description: Evaluate a speaker's point of view, reasoning, and use of evidence and rhetoric.

06A1E414EC5B49528C72E484576591D0.description: Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

74D1A395373F41258B1F91F5D29A8AF2.description: Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners, building on others' ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

FB03C5CB78D6441897D8B2DEE1E1E988.description: College and Career Readiness Standards: Speaking and Listening

7387E96F04264C8294221B4D79B1E2B0.description: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

B5385019BAC24F54A3F8C688AAA1AF8B.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

E0A86BB9722E4D1EBC54078206939C4B.description: Gather relevant information from multiple print and digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

58292F3A20434E2BAA6E1C16BB7B864E.description: Conduct short as well as more sustained research projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

D3EC8965B87C4FA89468F61D8CAD5417.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

177051109E86433EB8857E5223E7766B.description: Use technology, including the Internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

8DEE140789FE4513B9748AFDBBA363B2.description: Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, editing, rewriting, or trying a new approach.

773677474EE14F8EA5A1EBE79FC1446D.description: Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development, organization, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

B9435C2D3A13455DAD017102FEF9D4BB.description: Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen details and well-structured event sequences.

BE5C5B0322EB44649065B7FA7626B81F.description: Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

29BFC20E9E814AE6A8D15651735E7E39.description: Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts using valid reasoning and relevant and sufficient evidence.

7E73B5A36173435F8B8DFFC5DB74A928.description: College and Career Readiness Standards: Writing

F82B1DE399FE4306873BA668AE6D16FC.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

28E0403E2FB74604A632EBEBE7C8E2A6.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

433AEA15D5CF42A9BCB615E295CEAD91.description: Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the approaches the authors take.

0921EFBE8E854324901A4D305144097A.description: Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

B91A8A13F75947AE9665DC19607CD7D9.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively, as well as in words.

E542CF47E74546419ADE3338F367DC4F.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

FB948E09756C46FDB7C5AB15BD62A633.description: Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

0B53F7587B1D43DD9CF22A5CA97F5079.description: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, including determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings, and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

F62307234836426E9FFB7C44CB58E00F.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

8259B6E52735431FA636B3818A644D19.description: Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

F6255E3C7BFC48A1B18750E37181C18F.description: Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

43CDED2F85F44FCE9272CFA3D0398D11.description: College and Career Readiness Standards: Reading
